27 class VideoStream(object):
28 
29  def __init__(self, calibration_object, publisher_compressed_stream, flip_img=False):
30  self._calibration_object = calibration_object
31  self._publisher_compressed_stream = publisher_compressed_stream
32 
33  self._undistort_stream = rospy.get_param('~undistort_stream')
34  self._display = rospy.get_param("~display")
35  self._frame_rate = rospy.get_param("~frame_rate")
36  self._subsample_read = rospy.get_param("~subsampling")
37 
38  rospy.logdebug("VideoStream.init - undistort_stream: {}".format(self._undistort_stream))
39  rospy.logdebug("VideoStream.init - display: {}".format(self._display))
40  rospy.logdebug("VideoStream.init - frame_rate: {}".format(self._frame_rate))
41  rospy.logdebug("VideoStream.init - subsampling: {}".format(self._subsample_read))
42 
43  self._actualization_rate_ros = rospy.Rate(1.1 * int(self._frame_rate))
44 
45  self._saturation = 1.0
46  self._contrast = 1.0
47  self._brightness = 1.0
48  self._flip_img = flip_img
49 
50  # - Publisher about Running/Stopped Stream
51  self._running = False
52  self._should_run = False
53 
54  self._publisher_camera_stream_running = rospy.Publisher('~video_stream_is_active', Bool, queue_size=2)
55  self._publisher_stream_parameters = rospy.Publisher('~video_stream_parameters',
56  ImageParameters,
57  queue_size=2,
58  latch=True)
59  self._publish_image_parameters()
60 
61  rospy.Timer(rospy.Duration(1.0 / rospy.get_param("~is_active_rate")), self._publish_is_active)
62 
63  # - SERVICES
64  rospy.Service('~start_stop_video_streaming', SetBool, self._callback_start_stop)
65  rospy.Service('~set_saturation', SetImageParameter, self._callback_set_saturation)
66  rospy.Service('~set_brightness', SetImageParameter, self._callback_set_brightness)
67  rospy.Service('~set_contrast', SetImageParameter, self._callback_set_contrast)
68 
69  # -- CALLBACKS
70  def _callback_start_stop(self, req):
71  command = ["stopping", "starting"][int(req.value)]
72  if command == "stopping":
73  if not self._running:
74  message = "The video stream is already stopped."
75  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, message
76 
77  else:
78  self._should_run = False
79 
80  for _ in range(30):
81  if not self._running:
82  break
83  rospy.sleep(0.1)
84  else:
85  message = "Failed to stop the video stream !"
86  rospy.loginfo("Vision Node - " + message)
87 
88  return CommandStatus.VIDEO_STREAM_ON_OFF_FAILURE, message
89 
90  message = "Stream stopped"
91  rospy.loginfo("Vision Node - " + message)
92 
93  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, message
94 
95  else:
96  if self._running:
97  message = "The video stream is already running."
98  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, message
99  else:
100  rospy.loginfo("Vision Node - Trying to launch the stream ...")
101  self._should_run = True
102 
103  # Updating last read time to avoid instant stop
104  self.__last_time_read = rospy.get_time()
105 
106  for _ in range(100):
107  if self._running:
108  break
109  rospy.sleep(0.1)
110  else:
111  message = "Failed to relaunch the stream !"
112  rospy.loginfo("Vision Node - " + message)
113 
114  return CommandStatus.VIDEO_STREAM_ON_OFF_FAILURE, message
115 
116  message = "Stream relaunched !"
117  rospy.loginfo("Vision Node - " + message)
118 
119  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, message
120 
121  def _callback_set_saturation(self, req):
122  self._saturation = req.factor
123  self._publish_image_parameters()
124  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, "Success"
125 
126  def _callback_set_brightness(self, req):
127  self._brightness = req.factor
128  self._publish_image_parameters()
129  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, "Success"
130 
131  def _callback_set_contrast(self, req):
132  self._contrast = req.factor
133  self._publish_image_parameters()
134  return CommandStatus.SUCCESS, "Success"
135 
136  def _publish_is_active(self, _):
137  self._publisher_camera_stream_running.publish(self._running)
138 
139  def _publish_image_parameters(self):
140  self._publisher_stream_parameters.publish(self._brightness, self._contrast, self._saturation)
141 
142  # -- METHODS
143  def read_undistorted(self):
144  raise NotImplementedError
145 
146  def read_raw_img(self):
147  raise NotImplementedError
148 
149  def start(self):
150  self._should_run = True
151  t = Thread(target=self._loop, name="Camera Thread")
152  t.start()
153 
154  def _loop(self):
155  raise NotImplementedError
156 
157  def adjust_image(self, img):
158  if self._brightness == self._contrast == self._saturation == 1.:
159  return img
160 
161  im_pil = PILImage.fromarray(img)
162 
163  if self._brightness != 1.:
164  brightness_filter = ImageEnhance.Brightness(im_pil)
165  im_pil = brightness_filter.enhance(self._brightness)
166 
167  if self._contrast != 1.:
168  contrast_filter = ImageEnhance.Contrast(im_pil)
169  im_pil = contrast_filter.enhance(self._contrast)
170 
171  if self._saturation != 1.:
172  color_filter = ImageEnhance.Color(im_pil)
173  im_pil = color_filter.enhance(self._saturation)
174 
175  # For reversing the operation:
176  im_np = np.asarray(im_pil)
177  return im_np
178 
179 
180 class WebcamStream(VideoStream):
181 
182  def __init__(self, calibration_object, publisher_compressed_stream, flip_img=False):
183  super(WebcamStream, self).__init__(calibration_object, publisher_compressed_stream, flip_img)
184 
185  self.__cam_port = rospy.get_param("~camera_port")
186  restart_rate = rospy.get_param("~restart_rate")
187  self.__actualization_rate_no_stream = rospy.Rate(restart_rate)
188  self.__max_restart_time = rospy.get_param("~max_restart_time")
189 
190  rospy.logdebug("WebcamStream.init - camera_port: {}".format(self.__cam_port))
191  rospy.logdebug("WebcamStream.init - restart_rate: {}".format(restart_rate))
192  rospy.logdebug("WebcamStream.init - max_restart_time: {}".format(self.__max_restart_time))
193 
194  self.__last_time_read = None
195  self.__frame_raw = None
196  self.__frame_undistort = None
197 
198  self.__lock_image = Lock()
199 
200  # Stop Stream handling
201  self.__count_grab_failed = 0
202 
203  # -- PUBLIC
204 
205  def read_undistorted(self):
206  frame = self.read_raw_img()
207  if frame is None:
208  return None
209 
210  if self._calibration_object.is_set():
211  img = self._calibration_object.undistort_image(frame)
212  return cv2.flip(frame, -1) if self._flip_img else img
213  else:
214  return cv2.flip(frame, -1) if self._flip_img else frame
215 
216  def read_raw_img(self):
217  if not self._running or not self._should_run:
218  return None
219  with self.__lock_image:
220  ret, frame = self.__video_stream.retrieve()
221  if ret is False:
222  return None
223 
224  frame = self.adjust_image(frame)
225  return frame
226 
227  # -- Private
228  def __setup_stream_settings(self):
229  # Set compression format
230  self.__video_stream.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FOURCC, cv2.VideoWriter_fourcc('M', 'J', 'P', 'G'))
231 
232  # Set image size
233  w, h = rospy.get_param("~frame_size")
234  self.__video_stream.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_WIDTH, w)
235  self.__video_stream.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FRAME_HEIGHT, h)
236  # Set frame rate
237  self.__video_stream.set(cv2.CAP_PROP_FPS, self._frame_rate)
238 
239  def _loop(self):
240  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
241  if not self._should_run:
242  self._running = False
243  self.__actualization_rate_no_stream.sleep()
244  continue
245 
246  self.__video_stream = cv2.VideoCapture(self.__cam_port)
247  if not self.__video_stream.isOpened():
248  rospy.logwarn_throttle(10.0, "Vision Node - Failed to open video stream. Check camera is well plugged.")
249  self._running = False
250  if self.__last_time_read is None or \
251  (rospy.get_time() - self.__last_time_read) > self.__max_restart_time:
252  self._should_run = False
253  self.__actualization_rate_no_stream.sleep()
254  continue
255 
256  rospy.loginfo("Vision Node - Video Stream Open")
257  self.__setup_stream_settings()
258  self.__acquisition_loop()
259 
260  self.__video_stream.release()
261  rospy.loginfo("Vision Node - Video Stream Stopped")
262  self._running = False
263 
264  def __acquisition_loop(self):
265  self._running = True
266  self._should_run = True
267 
268  index_read = -1
269  while not rospy.is_shutdown() and self._should_run:
270  index_read = (index_read + 1) % self._subsample_read
271 
272  with self.__lock_image:
273  bool_grabbed = self.__video_stream.grab()
274 
275  if not bool_grabbed:
276  rospy.logwarn("Vision Node - Image not grabbed. Camera may have been unplugged.")
277  rospy.logwarn("Vision Node - Closing Video Stream")
278  break
279 
280  if index_read == 0:
281  _, frame = self.__video_stream.retrieve()
282  self.__last_time_read = rospy.get_time()
283  self.__frame_raw = frame
284 
285  if self._undistort_stream:
286  self.__frame_undistort = self._calibration_object.undistort_image(frame)
287  used_image = self.__frame_undistort
288  else:
289  self.__frame_undistort = None
290  used_image = self.__frame_raw
291 
292  used_image = self.adjust_image(used_image)
293  if self._flip_img:
294  used_image = cv2.flip(used_image, -1)
295  if self._display:
296  cv2.imshow("Video Stream", used_image)
297  cv2.waitKey(1)
298  result, msg = generate_msg_from_image(used_image)
299 
300  if not result:
301  continue
302  rospy.logdebug("Vision Node - Publishing an image")
303  try:
304  self._publisher_compressed_stream.publish(msg)
305  except rospy.ROSException:
306  return
307  self._actualization_rate_ros.sleep()
308 
309 
310 class GazeboStream(VideoStream):
311 
312  def __init__(self, calibration_object, publisher_compressed_stream, flip_img=False):
313  super(GazeboStream, self).__init__(calibration_object, publisher_compressed_stream, flip_img)
314 
315  self.__image_raw_sub = rospy.Subscriber('/gazebo_camera/image_raw', Image, self.__callback_sub_image_raw)
316  self.__image_compressed_sub = rospy.Subscriber('/gazebo_camera/image_raw/compressed',
317  CompressedImage,
318  self.__callback_sub_image_compressed)
319  self.__bridge = CvBridge()
320  self.__last_image_raw = None
321  self.__last_image_compressed_msg = CompressedImage()
322 
323  self._running = True
324  self._should_run = True
325 
326  def __callback_sub_image_raw(self, image_message):
327  img = self.__bridge.imgmsg_to_cv2(image_message, desired_encoding="bgr8")
328  self.__last_image_raw = self.adjust_image(img)
329 
330  def __callback_sub_image_compressed(self, msg):
331  self.__last_image_compressed_msg = msg
332 
333  def read_undistorted(self):
334  if self.__last_image_raw is None:
335  return None
336  if self._calibration_object.is_set():
337  img = self._calibration_object.undistort_image(self.__last_image_raw)
338  return cv2.flip(img, -1) if self._flip_img else img
339  else:
340  return cv2.flip(self.__last_image_raw, -1) if self._flip_img else self.__last_image_raw
341 
342  def read_raw_img(self):
343  return self.__last_image_raw
344 
345  def _loop(self):
346  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
347  if not self._should_run:
348  self._running = False
349  self._actualization_rate_ros.sleep()
350  continue
351 
352  self._running = True
353 
354  if self.__last_image_raw is not None:
355  cv2.imshow("Video Stream",
356  cv2.flip(self.__last_image_raw, -1) if self._flip_img else self.__last_image_raw)
357  cv2.waitKey(1)
358 
359  try:
360  self._publisher_compressed_stream.publish(self.__last_image_compressed_msg)
361  except rospy.ROSException:
362  return
363 
364  try:
365  self._actualization_rate_ros.sleep()
366  except rospy.ROSInterruptException:
367  return
